title: Zone 5 Training Protocol
content: The approach to zone 5 training, and other anaerobic training protocols includes one time per week using a stairmaster with a 4 minute pattern: 3 minutes of zone 2 and 1 minute at VO2 max. This is repeated for 20-30 minutes usually on the tail end of a zone two workout (longer aerobic day). It's important to know your VO2 max and also the conversion to METS which the stairmaster can track. Zone 5 can also be done on a bike: Four minutes at 125% of FTP (functional threshold power) followed by four minutes recovery. A one to one work/rest at a lower intensity than the 3 to 1 one rest to work that described on the stairmaster. The view is most people spend too much time there and not enough time in zone 2.
